job.title: Software Development Engineer (Performance)
job.industry: Computer Software,Human Resources,Information Technology and Services
job.description: At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work. The Performance Customer Operations influences development and Operations teams to bring a change by emphasizing the need to address the problems. We triage and learn the root cause of recurring performance bottlenecks. We measure the impact on customers and system resources backed by data. We assist various teams to analyze the performance impact caused by new features, services and micro-services before they go live. We build tools to enable our team and partners to function better. We always thrive to acknowledge the changes we need to bring in performance organization and get aligned with organizations goals. Performance Software Engineers are highly skilled engineers who debug, measure, analyze, and improve our Workday software. They are folks with deep technical understanding of software, hardware, networking, and the Internet, who enjoy taking a holistic view of sophisticated systems. Application Performance is achieved by working closely with all our engineering teams throughout the release cycle. Our ultimate goal is application performance that yields an excellent end user experience and scales to meet Software as a Service Infrastructure needs.   This position is located in Pleasanton, California., Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.
